etymology.description: 工程 + 师 = engineer/specialist in engineering
etymology.interpretation: Combines the field 工程 with the professional suffix 师 to denote a trained specialist. Literally an “engineering master/professional.”
etymology.simplification: 師 → 师 by character simplification; reduced strokes for a high‑frequency professional suffix.

examples.chinese: 他是一名软件工程师(他是一名軟體工程師)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yī míng ruǎnjiàn gōngchéngshī.

examples.chinese: 她通过考试成为注册工程师(她通過考試成為註冊工程師)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tōngguò kǎoshì chéngwéi zhùcè gōngchéngshī.
examples.english: She passed the exam to become a licensed engineer.

examples.chinese: 工程师负责设计和维护系统(工程師負責設計和維護系統)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngchéngshī fùzé shèjì hé wéihù xìtǒng.
examples.english: Engineers are responsible for designing and maintaining systems.
